title: Time and Dates
sentences: Today is Monday and I have a lot of work.
fue un día muy divertido con mis amigos.
Yesterday was a very fun day with my friends.
What are you going to do tomorrow afternoon?
Mi cumpleaños es en el mes de
My birthday is in the month of March.
We are in December and it is very cold.
Next year I want to travel to Peru.
Tengo una cita con el médico el
I have a doctor's appointment on Thursday.
On the weekend I like to sleep in late.
What is the date today? Tenth or eleventh?
I arrive early at the office every morning.
I'm sorry, I'm arriving a bit late because of the traffic.
See you later in the cafeteria.
What time is it on your watch?
It is midday and I am already very hungry.
no puedo hablar, estoy en una reunión.
I can't talk right now; I'm in a meeting.
First I study and then (afterwards) I watch television.
Normally I drink coffee in the mornings.
I always do sports on Saturdays.
I never eat meat because I am a vegetarian.
Sometimes I go to the cinema alone.
This century is very different from the previous one.
There are a few minutes left before the movie starts.
dictionary:
El lunes - Monday
El jueves - Thursday
El marzo - March
El diciembre - December
La semana - The week
El año - The year
La fecha - The date
Ayer - Yesterday
Mañana - Tomorrow / Morning
Hoy - Today
Luego - Later
Temprano - Early
Tarde - Late / Afternoon
La hora - The hour / time
Mediodía - Midday
Medianoche - Midnight
Ahora - Now
Antes - Before
Después - After / Afterwards
Normalmente - Normally
Siempre - Always
Nunca - Never
A veces - Sometimes
El siglo - The century
El minuto - The minute
